intro: Voyria primuloides, commonly known as the fairy bells, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its distinctive bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and is often found in heathlands and forested areas. It produces small, leathery leaves and has a compact, low-growing habit. Voyria primuloides is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in supporting local wildlife.
